Pre-Game Insights: India's opening batsmen KL Rahul, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav are in form
Key bowlers Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Arshdeep Singh and Mohd Shami do look to manage any conditions
England's Captain Jos Buttler and Alex Hales have been the source of most of the runs for the team
Bowling attack by pacers Mark Wood and Sam Curran can promise a tough start to Indian batters
Fielding seems to be an issue for the English side
India's return of opener KL Rahul's form has been a boon
Virat Kohli's consistent powerful knocks has been a key changer
Suryakumar Yadav has been phenomenal with his ferocious batting
Arshdeep Singh has shown some promising spells
Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Mohd Shami did their job too
India's cons are its fielding and middle order bowling
Spinners have not been that effective, though have managed to take wickets
England's possible XI includes Jos Buttler (c and wk), Alex Hales, Phil Salt, Harry Brook, Ben Stokes, Liam Livingstone, Moeen Ali, Sam Curran, Chris Woakes, Adil Rashid, Mark Wood

India's possible XI includes KL Rahul, Rohit Sharma (c), Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Hardik Pandya, Dinesh Karthik/Rishabh Pant (wk), Axar Patel/Yuzvendra Chahal, Ravichandran Ashwin, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Mohammed Shami, Arshdeep Singh
Miscellaneous Highlights: Weather in Adelaide Oval will be partly cloudy with no chances of rain
The temperatures will hover between 22° C to 13° C
The pitch in Adelaide Oval has been bouncy and good for batting, with short square boundaries
Despite bouncy pitches, spinners will also get favours
